com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api

Enum RS232Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<RS232Configuration>
      • com.pyramidacceptors.ptalk.api.RS232Configuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<RS232Configuration>

    public enum RS232Configuration
extends java.lang.Enum<RS232Configuration>
    RS-232 states, events and errors as defined in the RS-232 Spec.

    Since:
    1.0.0.0

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • INSTANCE

        public static final RS232Configuration INSTANCE
        Instance is singleton of RS232Configuration. This contains
        all state, event, and error information pertaining to the attached slave.

      • getPollrate

        public int getPollrate()
        Returns the current poll rate is milliseconds. This is the rate at which the master will query the slave.
        Returns:
        int

      • setPollrate

        public boolean setPollrate(int pollrate)
        Sets the pollrate in . his is the rate at which the master is querying the slave.
        Parameters:
        pollrate - integer poll rate
        Returns:
        true if poll rate was succesfully set

      • getPollRetryLimit

        public int getPollRetryLimit()
        Returns the number of retries the polling loop will allow before giving up and raising a connection failure events. Once this limit is reached, the polling thread will raise a connection failure event until either the polling loop is stopped or the target comes back online.
        Returns:
        int

      • setPollRetryLimit

        public boolean setPollRetryLimit(int limit)
        Sets the polling retry limit for the polling loop. This limit determines how many communication failures (e.g. non-responsive, IOExceptions, etc.) before connection falilure events begin being emitted. The limit must be >= 0. Default: 5
        Parameters:
        limit - int
        Returns:
        boolean true of limit was applied successfully. False is limit is invalid.

      • getEventMask

        public int getEventMask()
        Returns:
        the current event mask

      • getEnableMask

        public int getEnableMask()
        Returns:
        the current mask used for enabling or disabling acceptance
        of notes.

      • setEventMask

        public void setEventMask(int mask)
        Events are the foundation of the PTalk, event driven API. As a client,
        you are able to select which events (interface dependent) you want
        notification for. The mask is a bitwise integer where 1 indicates active and indicates
        inactive.
        Parameters:
        mask - bitwise event mask
        See Also:
        for bit indicies

      • setEnableMask

        public void setEnableMask(int mask)
        Serial Protocol often allow for the enable/disable of bills or other
        features via a bit mask. This implementation supports an integer mask
        where 1 indicates the feature is enabled and 0 indicates that it is
        disabled.
        Parameters:
        mask - bitwise enable/disable mask. Set bit position to 1 to enable, 0 to disable.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the bill acceptor. If disabled. the master will still be able to poll and receive status messages from the slave but acceptance is disabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable, false to disable

      • setEscrowMode

        public void setEscrowMode(boolean enable)
        Enable or disable escrow mode on the slave device. This puts the host in charge of giving the final accept/reject command. This feature is not correctly implemented so it has been disabled. It was originally based off of a broken VB implementation which did not align with the specs.
        Parameters:
        enable - true will enable the device, false will disable

      • getEscrowMode

        public boolean getEscrowMode()
        Returns:
        true if the device is in escrow mode, otherwise false
